text:
- All right, that's a wrap.
- Mark.

- When the camera is off--
- We're still on.

- ♪ It's the truth ♪
- ♪ The truth ♪

- ♪ The truth with Ruth ♪
- ♪ With Ruth and Ava, too ♪

- ♪ It's true ♪
- ♪ That's me and you ♪
♪ On the truth ♪
What's our next question?

This one is about
feeling all the feels.
Ugh. And how to deal?

Yep. Anger, jealousy,
sadness, it all happens.

And it's really important
to admit that you have them.

Like, sometimes
when somebody asks you,

"How are you feeling?",
and you say,

"Oh, well, I'm fine,"
but you're really not inside?

A lot of the time, it makes
the situation even worse.

Exactly.
And you should talk through
your feelings, not hide it.

That even happened
on our show.

Ruth: When Sydney
and her dad weren't honest

about how they felt
about his new girlfriend,
it just made everything worse.

I know it's
difficult sometimes

to talk it out,
but it always helps.

Hey, Ruth, can I tell you
some of the feelings

- I'm feeling right now?
- Yes.

I'm really happy
to be your friend.

And you want to know
what I'm feeling?

I'm really happy
to be your friend, too.
Man: Back on in two.

Oh, do you know
what else I'm feeling?

That we should be
getting back on set.

- See you soon.
- Bye!

Keep watching
"Sydney To The Max"...
On Disney Channel.
